alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:16AM CDT until April 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OVERTON...NORTHERN SMITH...JACKSON...SOUTHEASTERN SUMNER...NORTHEASTERN WILSON...CLAY...MACON AND TROUSDALE COUNTIES... At 116 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Celina to near Hartsville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Lafayette, Livingston, Carthage, Celina, Gainesboro, Hartsville, Westmoreland, Red Boiling Springs, Moss, Whitleyville, Dixon Springs, Pleasant Shade, Bledsoe Creek State Park, Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area, Dale Hollow Lake and Standing Stone State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
